text: Anderson Valley Unified School District, a public school district based in Boonville, Mendocino County, California, provides compulsory public primary and secondary education in the entirety of the nearly 20 mile long Anderson Valley, from the Mendocino County line north of Cloverdale to White Gulch, six miles north of Navarro. The district has 2,863 residents and averages a total enrollment of over 500 students. The district operates five schools, all of which are located (along with the district office) in Boonville. == Schools == {| class="wikitable sortable" style="margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; border-spacing: 2px; border: 2px solid darkgray;" |+ Anderson Valley Unified Schools ! title: Anderson Valley Unified School District
